Curried Chili (meat optional)

beef
vegetarian
chili
curry

Ingredients

Chili

  • 1/2 yellow onion (diced)
  • 1 small jalapeno (optional)
  • 1 clove garlic (minced)
  • 1/2 lb ground beef (optional)
  • 1 can black beans (drained) (if not using ground beef)
  • 1/2 inch fresh ginger, peeled and finely grated
  • 2 tsp curry powder
  • 1/2 tsp cumin
  • 1/4 tsp coriander
  • 1/4 tsp turmeric
  • 1/4 tsp smoked paprika
  • 1/8 tsp cayenne (optional)
  • 1 tsp kosher salt
  • 1/2 tsp freshly ground black pepper
  • 8 oz can diced tomatoes
  • 8 oz can tomato sauce
  • 1/4 cup broth (beef/chicken/veggie)
  • 15 oz can chickpeas

Serving

  • sour cream/greek yogurt
  • lime
  • shredded cheese (dealers choice on kind)

Procedure

  1. Large pot or dutch oven over medium high heat.
  2. Add onion and jalapenos and cook until onion softens about 4 minutes
  3. If using ground beef, add now, cook until no longer pink
  4. Add garlic and ginger to pan and heat until fragrant (about 30 seconds)
  5. Add curry, cumin, coriander, turmeric, smoked paprika, cayenne, salt, and pepper to pan and cook until fragrant (about 2 minutes)
  6. Add diced tomato, tomato sauce, and beef broth and bring to boil.
  7. Reduce to simmer, cover and cook for about 20 minutes
  8. Add chickpeas (and black beans of vegetarian) and cover and cook for another 10 minutes
  9. Serve with any desired toppings
